result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlow C. Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CF121.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant to maintain status as a participant in good standing in the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlow C. Hess

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Arlow C. Hess
Current: 9259 32nd St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2015)
Prior: 608 Main Street, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States

15CF77 & 15CF121 Cases called @ 2:41 p.m. Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CF121 - Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping contrary to Wis Stat 946.49(1)(a).  Plea: 15CF77 Ct 1 - Guilty. 15CF121 Ct 1 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CF77 Ct 2- DRI. 15CF121 Ct 2 - DRI. Repeater enhancer on 15CF121 Ct 1 dismissed. Statement by DE. Court orders: 15CF77 - S/W 30 mos probation - 4 days CFTS, Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 

15CF121 - 120 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 44 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - concurrent with 15CF77 -Maintain status as a participant in good standing in the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program. All other conditions the same as 15CF77. Appeal rights given.

ADDRESS INFO for Arlow C. Hess

Prior: 100 S Military St, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Confirmation of acceptance into the Waushara County TAD program. Attorney Szilagyi also provided an updated address within Waushara County to Clerk of Court-Per order of the court-bond may be amended.

11:30 am case called. Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Arlow C. Hess in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi regarding the request of the defendant to participate in the TAD program. Further statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by ADA Anderson. Statement by Court regarding request for bond modification. Court will permit the amendment of bond upon application to the TAD program, acceptance, and establishing residence within Waushara County.

15CF-77 and 15CF-121 - Both Cases Called @ 3:40 PM: Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Readings Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today as to both matters. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing as to both matters.  Def BOT.  INFO filed as to each matter.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered as to both matters.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m.  Defendant Arlow C. Hess in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000-$2000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi has no position on bond at this time. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
